content.question: The figure shows blocks with different masses hanging from a spring or combination of two springs. All the springs are ideal and have spring constants of <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> . Which of the following correctly ranks the systems in order of most stored elastic potential energy to least stored elastic potential energy when the spring systems are stretched a distance <math alttext="d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from their unstretched length?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 is greater than 2, which is greater than 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn><mo>></mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="1 is greater than 3, which is greater than 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>></mo><mn>3</mn><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="2 is greater than 1, which is greater than 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn><mo>></mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="3 is greater than 1, which is greater than 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3 is greater than 1, which is greater than 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
